alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Luzerne; Susquehanna; Wayne; Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 5:44PM EDT until March 31 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Binghamton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Delaware County in central New York... Northwestern Sullivan County in central New York... Southeastern Susquehanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Lackawanna County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Wayne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Northern Luzerne County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Eastern Wyoming County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 544 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near New Milford to near Dickson City to near Muhlenberg, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Scranton, Wilkes-Barre, Falls, Dunmore, Kingston, Nanticoke, Plains, Carbondale, Old Forge and Pittston. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Heavy rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
